parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post does not contain a CMF number. While the absence of a CMF number is not automatically disqualifying, it suggests the post might not be directly linked to official electoral campaign materials.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post refers to Manolache Vasile, a senatorial candidate.  The phrase "Pe 1 decembrie, hai să votăm pentru un viitor construit pe valori reale – familie, respect și conștiință" directly encourages voting, linking it to the candidate's values. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently targeting a wide audience. The use of hashtags like #ManolacheVasileSenator further indicates an intention to reach a broad public, fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's explicit call to vote ("Pe 1 decembrie, hai să votăm...") and its focus on values associated with the candidate clearly aim to influence voters' choices. The overall message promotes the candidate's platform and implicitly encourages support, fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. It lacks objective reporting, analysis, or diverse perspectives. Instead, it promotes a specific candidate and their views, making it promotional rather than journalistic.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>While the post expresses personal opinions, these are presented within a clear framework of electoral campaigning. The personal opinions are used to promote the candidate and influence voters, not simply to express personal views.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1746697239416114</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post, while not explicitly mentioning voting for Manolache Vasile, strongly implies it through its call to vote for a future based on the values he espouses. The paid nature of the Facebook post, targeting a wide audience in Bistrița-Năsăud County and surrounding areas, and the clear connection between the promoted values and the candidate's platform, strongly suggest this is electoral propaganda.  The timing of the post, considering the provided end date, needs to be checked against the official end date of the electoral campaign. If the post was published after the legal deadline for electoral propaganda, it would constitute a violation.  The absence of a CMF number is a mitigating factor, but not sufficient to negate the overall promotional nature of the post.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Manolache Vasile</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>MOMENTUM</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Momentum Motion Pictures SRL, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei reclame plătite pe Facebook (ID postare: 1746697239416114) care promovează candidatul la Senat Manolache Vasile,  prin asocierea valorilor sale (familie, respect, conștiință) cu un apel implicit la vot ("Pe 1 decembrie, hai să votăm pentru un viitor construit pe valori reale – familie, respect și conștiință").  Reclama, având în vedere publicul țintă (județul Bistrița-Năsăud și zonele limitrofe) și cheltuielile implicate, are un efect electoral clar, obiectivul fiind influențarea votului în favoarea candidatului.  Lipsa unui număr CMF nu exonerează de răspundere, având în vedere caracterul evident de propagandă electorală al mesajului.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
